intro: Hebanthe mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, often opening in the morning. Hebanthe mollis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar growth habits.
